summary: Luis Posada Carriles was a Venezuelan citizen of Cuban origin who is mentioned in several CIA documents. He was allegedly a former CIA asset (WKSCARLET/3) and the documents span from 1966 to 1978. The documents indicate CIA interest and involvement with him, including his cover status, polygraph results, investigative reports, and operational approvals. He attempted to offer his services to BKHERALD. He is also mentioned in connection to Fidel Castro's allegations of CIA involvement in the Cubana airliner bombing. HSCA notes from CIA files document information on Luis Posada Carriles, including aliases, references, identifiers, and contacts.
significance: The documents suggest that Luis Posada Carriles was a person of interest to the CIA, potentially an asset, with involvement in activities against Cuba. His name appears in the context of allegations of CIA involvement in the Cubana airliner bombing, although the documents do not directly link him to the JFK assassination. His connections to individuals and organizations involved in anti-Castro activities are notable.
